alert.note: Alert for Glacier (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 5:09PM MDT until June 08 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Glacier, Pondera and Toole. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rock falls and flowing water on road surfaces are likely in mountainous areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 1 and 3 inches of rain has already fallen across most of the advised area due to thunderstorms, with additional heavy rain expected through the evening hours tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelby, Cut Bank, Browning, Valier, Sunburst, Kevin, North Browning, South Browning, Heart Butte, East Glacier Park, East Glacier Park Village, Kiowa, Sweet Grass, Starr School, Santa Rita, Saint Mary, Babb, Marias Pass, Ethridge and Many Glacier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
